thread.title: Sun Devil football pep rally in Payson
thread.title_full: Sun Devil football pep rally in Payson

author: Bob Young
title: Sun Devil football pep rally in Payson
text:
When the monsoon begins to wane, it’s time for Arizona State University’s football team to head for Camp Tontozona, the picturesque pigskin retreat tucked beneath the Mogollon Rim.
It’s also time for Sun Devils fans to zip through Payson en route to and from “Camp T,” stopping only for fast food or to fill the gas tank.
This year, the Payson Parks and Recreation and Tourism Department hopes to give fans an incentive to stop awhile by presenting a Sun Devil Football Pep Rally on Friday, Aug. 14, at Green Valley Park.
“Normally what happens is Camp T week falls on the same week as the World’s Oldest Continuous Rodeo here,” said Cameron Davis, director of Payson Parks and Recreation and Tourism. “The way the timing worked out, the rodeo is not until the week after Tontozona this year, so the town is putting all its muscle behind this pep rally.
RELATED: Payson and beyond: Rim Country getaways
“We want as much of Sun Devil Nation as possible to come up and enjoy a weekend in Payson in our beautiful weather, cheering on their team.”
The four-hour event, developed in conjunction with ASU, takes place on the eve of the team’s annual Maroon and Gold Scrimmage, which typically draws thousands of fans. The Sun Devils will practice at Camp T, about 17 miles east of Payson off State Route 260, from Aug.11-15 in preparation for their Sept. 5 season opener against Texas A&M.
Former ASU star Danny White will address fans and sign autographs to kick off the pep rally. The Sun Devil Spirit Squad cheerleaders will perform, and mascot Sparky is expected to arrive via a medical helicopter. He might also want to depart by air evac after taking part in several challenges, including a push-up contest, with fans.
Davis said there will be food vendors and other attractions, such as face painting. The highlight, though, might be the NFL-style football skills course.
Fans can test their abilities in sprinting, throwing and kicking, or take part in strength challenges. One challenge pits two combatants connected by a rope who must battle the pull one another out of a ring.
RELATED: Arizona hike: Round Valley Trail, Payson
Times and other results will be posted on a leader board so fans can see how they stack up. Fans of all ages can take part.
A giant screen will play ASU football promotional videos, and Payson High School’s cheerleaders and marching band will perform.
The band Zero Gravity Fighters will take the stage at 7 p.m. and play until 9 p.m.
The Maroon and Gold Scrimmage starts at about 10 a.m. Saturday at Camp Tontozona.
Details: 5-9 p.m. Friday, Aug. 14. Green Valley Park, 1000 W. Country Club Drive, Payson. Free. 928-474-5242, ext. 7.; paysonrimcountry.com .
5 more things to do in Rim Country
Tonto Natural Bridge State Park: A short hike takes visitors below what is believed to be the world’s largest natural travertine bridge, measuring 183 feet in height and spanning 150 feet in width to form a passage nearly 400 feet in length. 10 miles north of Payson off State Route 87. $2-$5. azstateparks.com/Parks/TONA .
Rim Country Museums and Zane Grey Cabin: These are adjacent to Green Valley Park, the site of the pep rally. The museums include a replica of the cabin used by Zane Grey when he wrote his Western novels and magazine serials. The original burned in the Dude Fire 25 years ago not far from Camp Tontozona. $3-$5. rimcountrymuseums.com .
Tonto Creek Fish Hatchery: The hatchery has operated since 1937 and was surrounded by the 1990 Dude Fire. It survived and was renovated in 1993. It’s just a few miles from Camp Tontozona. The turnoff from SR 260 is directly across the road from Kohl’s Ranch Lodge. From there, it’s about a 4-mile drive to the hatchery, where there are some great hiking trails. Free. 928-478-4200, azgfd.gov/h_f/hatcheries_tonto_creek.shtml .
Craft beer at THAT Brewery: May we recommend the Arizona Trail Ale? This medium-body beer is one of eight house brews, and part of the proceeds from each pint of this one goes to maintaining the Arizona Trail — part of which can be hiked from the nearby Pine Trailhead. Lots of tasty food items on the menu, too, including an elk burger. 3270 N. SR 87, Pine. 928-476-3349, thatbrewery.com .
Ranch at Fossil Creek: The kids can meet a llama or milk a goat, and you will be happy to sample the tasty goat-milk cheeses and fudge made right there on the property. 10379 W. Fossil Creek Road, Strawberry. $5-$10 for goat petting and tours. 928-476-5178, r anchatfossilcreek.com .
